subject: Independent Settlement Mechanism-Submission of undertaking by Authorized Representative of the contractor and finalization of Settlement agreement.
text: HRTy <ezly  TTTHNf xifearut 344 Phone 91-11-25074100/25074200 (84 WRar7 3 <TTHTf AATT4) W87 / Fax 91-11-25093507 25093514 National Highways Authority of India (Ministry of Road Transport and Highways) T-5  6, 8izr-10, ERTT, 7 ferit-110075 G-5 & 6, Sector-10, Dwarka, New Delhi-110075 No. 11041/217/2007-Admn Dated: 11.11.2014 Policy Matters: Administration/Finance (154/2014) (Decision taken in file No.-NHAI/DR&A Cell/(Intertoll-Agra)/2005) Sub: Independent_Settlement_Mechanisam Submission_of_Undertaking_bY Authorised Representative of the Contractor finalizatioin of Settlement Agreement: It is well known that the Independent Settlement Mechanism as approved by the NHAI Board, is in place in NHAI for which two sets of 3 CGMs (Tech) Committees are functioning for process of negotiations: As soon as request is   submitted by the Contractor Concessionaire for amicable settlement, Authorized Representative of the Contractor Concessionaire submits detailed Undertaking primarily for keeping the Arbitral Proceedings etc. on hold, during the pendency of the process of negotiation. when the negotiation finalized and actual settlement gets approved as per the Iaid down procedure, a formal Settlement Agreement is signed between the NHAI and the concerned Contractor / Concessionaire. 2. Recently, in one case of settlement, disputes between the JV Partners have erupted in the form of litigation, dragging NHAI into it also though as Proforma Respondent: Thus as an abundant caution, additional clause can be inserted making the Contractor Concessionaire solely responsible for any financial consequences arising out of disputes amongst the JV Partners or Sub-Contractors wherein a Contractor Concessionaire needs to indemnify NHAI against any such loss or damage   This clause as given below, is required in the Settlement Agreement finally entered with the Contractor / Concessionaire: The Contractor further agrees to indemnify and hold harmless NHAI in respect of any future disputes raised by its JV Partners, sub-contractors or third parties on NHAI with   regard to the settlement of disputes by virtue of  this Agreement; including but not limited to any loss, damage, cost of litigation, etc 3. The above clause has to be incorporated as sub-clause 2.4 of the Settlement Agreement (copy enclosed): 4 This issues with the approval of Competent Authority: (V.KSharma) Chief General Manager (LA & Coord ) To: All officers and employees of HQ/ROs/PIUs/CMUs/Site Offices 'H1779 NHAI and Also, gets
